comment: I'd prefer the name `toggleTaskStatus` to the current one.
Have you considered to change the signature of this method to return a reference to the newly created Task? Same for the delete method.
I don't like much this implementation as it is not flexible. E.g.: what if I the sort by date has to be reversed?

for readability you can rewrite this in a single line as

```
task.done = !task.done;
```

even better would be to implement the method inside the Task class for separation of concerns as this class already handles inputs and outputs and it also handles the list.
might be worth to put all your literal in a dedicated class/variable instead of repeating them.
Have you considered implementing a `toString()` method directly in the `Task` class?

Why an inner static class? You are not accessing any of the enclosing class attributes. Also, consider to use getters/setters instead of direct state modification from enclosing class. It can help reducing class coupling.
